problem_text:
Suppose that U is a nonprincipal ultrafilter on ω, and B is a group such that every element b ∈ B belongs to a subgroup of B that is a homomorphic image of Z^ω/U.
Must B then be a homomorphic image of an ultraproduct group (∏_{i∈ω} Gi)/U for some groups Gi?
This is Question 19 in (G. M. Bergman, Pacific J. Math., 274 (2015) 451–495).
An affirmative answer would imply that every torsion group was such a homomorphic image for every U, and so would give positive answers to both parts of 21.11.
G. M. Bergman
